name: places/ChIJJ_YO2xFawokRnC7VnrkUNGI
formattedAddress: 70 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10280, USA
adrFormatAddress: 70 Battery Pl, New York, NY 10280, USA

originalText.text:
The parking price is through the roof. At the entrance the parking fare is much lower than the parking fare in the inside. On top of that, they never said in the beginning that $20 would be extra for SUV. When we went to get the car they charge us $73 . When I asked it says 53$ for up to 10 hours, the parking attendant mentioned it is for suv which would be charged 20$ extra. Our SUV was not oversize it was medium regular SUV Honda CRV.  When I told the attendant you need to explain that in the beginning just so we know it.  The parking attendant rudely commented that  you should have read it when I got here to park the car . When I said it is very expensive and the parking fares differs at the entrance, the parking attendant was staring at me with an angry look commenting that the entrance price is govt price  which doesn’t make any sense. And the audacity to ask for tip at the end. Management , please look into this, if the price is not supposed to be $73 for the regular suv for up to 10 hrs.
Such an awful experience for first time coming to New York!

originalText.text: Reserved my parking a few days before our trip through SpotHero. QR worked, car was fine, staff was helpful. No complaints. I will use them again if I need to park on that side of town.

text.text: Reserved my parking a few days before our trip through SpotHero. QR worked, car was fine, staff was helpful. No complaints. I will use them again if I need to park on that side of town.

originalText.text: I've been parking in Manhattan for the past 10 years, and I have NEVER had a worse experience.  Parking attendant was rude abrasive and completely harassed me.  I had reserved the two-hour parking in advance through Best Parking app.  I have been using this app for the past year with absolutely no issue.  Attendant told me that my reservation was not working and I would have to pay in cash.  I called Best Parking to make sure there was absolutely nothing wrong with my reservation.  I explained to the attendant that I would be happy to pay by credit card, and I would need a receipt of the transaction to get a refund for my payment through the app.  He told me that I could only pay in cash or he would not return my car.  He also told me his machine was not working properly, however I had seen him provide a receipt to the man who had just picked up his car a few minutes beforehand.  Parking attendant refused to give me his name or a phone number for management to handle the situation.  He forcefully thrust the keys and credit card at me, and made me get the car myself from the parking garage.  I took a picture of him for reference. I felt extremely shaken up by the situation, and hope that no other woman (or man) gets scammed by this guy.  I have contacted MPG Parking as well to report the incident.

originalText.text: Robbed my wife of $45.  We had a reservation made through ParkWhiz.  Attendant held-up his hand as we drove-in, asking whether we have a reservation.  We politely responded that we did, and showed him our QR code.  He insisted that he has no record of a reservation from us, and that it'll be $45 for parking.  We said we had already paid for our parking.  He insisted otherwise.  Upon checking-out our vehicle two hours later, he wouldn't accept credit card as form of payment, insisting both his credit card and machine are broken.  Demanded we pay cash.  Do yourselves a favor, stay away from places like this.  We're filing a complaint with the city today.

originalText.text: I showed up without a reservation around 8am on a Saturday for the early bird special. I picked up the car later that evening and paid the early bird special fee (under $20). The staff was quick and professional. I wouldn't hesitate to park there again.
